core.tool_helper module

Tool is LLM’s extended capability which is one of the core design pattern of Agent. All tools can be wrapped in a FunctionTool class. This helps to standardize the tool interface and metadata to communicate with the Agent.

class core.tool_helper.FunctionTool(metadata: ToolMetadata, fn: Callable[[...], Any] | None = None, async_fn: Callable[[...], Awaitable[Any]] | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

There is almost no need to customize a FunctionTool, but you can do so if you want to. Support both positional and keyword arguments. NOTE: - at least one of fn or async_fn must be provided. - When both are provided, sync (call) will be used in __call__.

async acall(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any) → ToolOutput[source]
property async_fn: Callable[[...], Awaitable[Any]]
call(*args: Any, **kwargs: Any) → ToolOutput[source]

class core.tool_helper.ToolMetadata(**data)[source]

Bases: ABC

Metadata for a tool. Can be passed to LLM for tool registration.

core.tool_helper.get_fun_schema(name: str, func: Callable[[...], Any]) → Dict[str, Any][source]

Get a schema for a function. Example: def example_function(x: int, y: str = “default”) -> int:

return x

schema = get_fun_schema(“example_function”, example_function) print(json.dumps(schema, indent=4)) # Output: {

“type”: “object”, “properties”: {

“x”: {

“type”: “int”

}, “y”: {

“type”: “str”, “default”: “default”

}

}, “required”: [

“x”

]

}
